skillTree.name: Nurgling Palanquin
skillTree.description: The palanquins of Nurgle are ornate thrones decorated in mouldering finery and decaying cushions.

skillTree.name: Rot Fly
skillTree.description: A colossal Daemon-insect, whose appearance is so repugnant it leaves festering scars upon the mind.

skillTree.name: Hates Tzeentch
skillTree.description: The Fly Lord and his devotees despise Tzeentch, for his obsession with schemes and trickery are the polar opposite of Nurgle's delight in slow, musty stagnation.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Tzeentchian factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Tzeentchian factions

skillTree.name: Bloated Carcass
skillTree.description: Anything fired at this vile Nurglish servant's immense girth must penetrate many folds of sweaty fat before they even have the slightest chance of piercing his flesh.

skillTree.name: Immortality
skillTree.description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say noâ€¦

effects.description: When normally killed in battle, this Lord will be wounded instead

ui_effects.description: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

skillTree.name: Eye of the Gods
skillTree.description: The Warriors of Chaos are the playthings of Gods and given many gifts, including formidable fighting skills.

skillTree.name: Devastating Charge
skillTree.description: Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.

skillTree.name: Thick-Skinned
skillTree.description: Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.

skillTree.name: Hard to Hit
skillTree.description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, itâ€™s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.

skillTree.name: Deadly Blade
skillTree.description: A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!

skillTree.name: Foe-Seeker
skillTree.description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

skillTree.name: Wound-Maker
skillTree.description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.

skillTree.name: Scarred Veteran
skillTree.description: The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.

skillTree.name: Indomitable
skillTree.description: The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.

skillTree.name: Blade Shield
skillTree.description: A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.

skillTree.name: Deadly Onslaught
skillTree.description: The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Miasma of Pestilence"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Miasma of Pestilence Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Miasma of Pestilence Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Stream of Corruption"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Stream of Corruption Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Stream of Corruption Upgraded"

ui_effects.description: Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker

effects.description: Overcast spell: "Curse of the Leper Upgraded"

ui_effects.description: Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker
Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker

effects.description: Overcast spell: "Curse of the Leper Upgraded"

ui_effects.description: Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker
Reflects melee damage dealt to unit back at the attacker

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Curse of the Leper"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Curse of the Leper Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Curse of the Leper Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Rancid Visitations"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Rancid Visitations Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Rancid Visitations Upgraded"

ui_effects.description: Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants
Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants
Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants
Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants
Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Fleshy Abundance"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Fleshy Abundance Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Fleshy Abundance Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Blight Boil"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Blight Boil Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Blight Boil Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +20% when increasing

skillTree.name: Inspiring Presence
skillTree.description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

skillTree.name: Rot-Eaters
skillTree.description: Imagine a rubbery, pus-filled bag lurching towards you. Now imagine it is travelling at twice its usual speed...

effects.description: Charge bonus: +3 for Plague Toad and Pox Rider units
Melee defence: +4 for Plague Toad and Pox Rider units
Charge bonus: +6 for Plague Toad and Pox Rider units
Melee defence: +6 for Plague Toad and Pox Rider units
Charge bonus: +9 for Plague Toad and Pox Rider units

skillTree.name: Armour of Malady
skillTree.description: Sensible enemies think at least twice before attacking such a diseased specimen, for even if they win, chances are they have caught something really nasty along the way.

effects.description: Armour: +4 for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Spawn of Nurgle and Forsaken of Nurgle units
Armour: +8 for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Spawn of Nurgle and Forsaken of Nurgle units
Melee defence: +4 for Spawn of Nurgle and Forsaken of Nurgle units
Armour: +12 for Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Spawn of Nurgle and Forsaken of Nurgle units
Melee defence: +6 for Spawn of Nurgle and Forsaken of Nurgle units

skillTree.name: Nauseating Mutations
skillTree.description: Grandfather loves the smallest of his many children at least as much as his myriad other grim creations, if not more so.

effects.description: Speed: +3% for Beast of Nurgle and Nurglings units
Speed: +5% for Beast of Nurgle and Nurglings units
Physical resistance: 3% for Beast of Nurgle and Nurglings units
Speed: +10% for Beast of Nurgle and Nurglings units
Physical resistance: 6% for Beast of Nurgle and Nurglings units

skillTree.name: Bubonic Buzzers
skillTree.description: The flying things are beloved of Nurgle, for they are, oft-times, the method of infection for his most potent, hideous infirmities.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Rot Flies, Plague Drones and Chaos Fury units
Melee attack: +4 for Rot Flies, Plague Drones and Chaos Fury units
Weapon strength: +8% for Rot Flies, Plague Drones and Chaos Fury units
Melee attack: +6 for Rot Flies, Plague Drones and Chaos Fury units
Weapon strength: +12% for Rot Flies, Plague Drones and Chaos Fury units

skillTree.name: Filth Incarnate
skillTree.description: None more foul. None more black. Yuk.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 for Great Unclean One and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units
Armour: +10 for Great Unclean One and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units
Melee defence: +4 for Great Unclean One and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units
Armour: +15 for Great Unclean One and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units
Melee defence: +6 for Great Unclean One and Soul Grinder of Nurgle units

ui_effects.description: Will spread to enemies within 30 metres of affected unit

skillTree.name: Virulent Contagion
skillTree.description: Sickness so vile that it strikes as true and as hard as the perfect sword-blow.

effects.description: Melee attack: +5 for Nurglings, Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Exalted Plaguebearers of Nurgle and Forsaken of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
Missile resistance: 15% for Nurglings, Plaguebearers of Nurgle, Exalted Plaguebearers of Nurgle and Forsaken of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.name: Cankerous Spread
skillTree.description: The corrosive ooze emanating from the most ulcerous sores is one of the most effective weapons in the Urfather's foul armoury.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for Pox Riders of Nurgle, Plague Toads of Nurgle and Spawn of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
Physical resistance: 10% for Pox Riders of Nurgle, Plague Toads of Nurgle and Spawn of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.name: Airborne Agues
skillTree.description: The air most creatures breathe provides just another avenue of attack for Nurgle and his many and varied contagions.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +12% for Chaos Furies, Rot Flies and Plague Drones of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)
Missile resistance: 15% for Chaos Furies, Rot Flies and Plague Drones of Nurgle units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.name: Putrid Resistance
skillTree.description: Blade and point and spell can be turned aside very easily by the Fly Lord's most-favoured servants.

effects.description: Melee attack: +7 for Beast of Nurgle, Soul Grinder and Great Unclean One units (Rank 7 and above)
Spell resistance: 15% for Beast of Nurgle, Soul Grinder and Great Unclean One units (Rank 7 and above)

ui_effects.description: Will spread to enemies within 30 metres of affected unit

skillTree.name: Route Marcher
skillTree.description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.

skillTree.name: Serve or Die
skillTree.description: "You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."

skillTree.name: Looter
skillTree.description: Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!

skillTree.name: Despoilers
skillTree.description: To despoil, to corrupt and ruin, to break the mortals and take their gods from them - this is what Chaos wants.

skillTree.name: Corruption
skillTree.description: With the servants of Chaos comes the corruption â€“ as the landscape twists, this one speeds the transformation.

skillTree.name: Unholy Resilience
skillTree.description: This willing servant of the Ruinous Powers has a resilience that is beyond any mortal measure.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord

skillTree.name: Lightning Strike
skillTree.description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.name: Blessed by Blight
skillTree.description: Just as all life is born, so it must wither and die. Before that happens comes disease, in all its disgusting, filth-ridden glory.

skillTree.name: Relentless Advance
skillTree.description: Battles can be lost, but can the war ever really be won? The advance of Ruin can never truly be halted once and for all.

effects.description: Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition

skillTree.name: Impure Prayer
skillTree.description: Uncleanliness is next to Godliness.

skillTree.name: Renowned & Feared
skillTree.description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

skillTree.name: Aggressive
skillTree.description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.

skillTree.name: Confident
skillTree.description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

skillTree.name: Cunning
skillTree.description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

skillTree.name: Disciplined
skillTree.description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.

skillTree.name: Fleet-Footed
skillTree.description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fightâ€¦ or when trying to get away afterwards!

skillTree.name: Intelligent
skillTree.description: Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

skillTree.name: Knowledgeable
skillTree.description: What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +5% when increasing
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve change: -10% when increasing

skillTree.name: Strategist
skillTree.description: This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.

skillTree.name: Strong
skillTree.description: Well built, robust. Powerful.

skillTree.name: Tactician
skillTree.description: Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

skillTree.name: Tough
skillTree.description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.

skillTree.name: Weapon Master
skillTree.description: If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.

skillTree.name: Perceptive
skillTree.description: Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

skillTree.name: Contagious
skillTree.description: If you spend almost any time too close to this vile infector you'll regret it, assuming you live to tell the tale that is.

skillTree.name: Fomenter
skillTree.description: Unusually subtle for one so foul, this one is skilled in spreading Nurgle's insanitary ways and words across the land.

skillTree.name: Repellent
skillTree.description: This one finds the enemy can barely stand to come near them, let alone attack.

skillTree.name: Scabrous
skillTree.description: When this one's countless lesions and warts finish weeping and harden up, a natural, protective carapace is left behind in their place.

skillTree.name: Infectious
skillTree.description: If a population are confined to their toilets or beds at home they're not able to spread dissent and sedition as readily, if at all.

skillTree.name: Corpulent
skillTree.description: Ogres aside, being this large and ungainly would almost certainly kill most other creatures, but when you're beloved of the Urfather it is actually an advantage.
